msItem.title: Tarjumah-i Qutb-Shahi.
msItem.note: According to Reade missing from bod 140, but it is there now, Oct 2009. Incomplete at end. F1a: Note in Arabic making the book waqf on the same conditions as 'rest of the books', beside a faint impression of an oval seal. A translation of the Arabic Arba'in Hadith of Baha' al-Din 'Amili, by Muhammad b. 'Ali 'Amili, known as Ibn Khatun, made for Sultan Muhammad Qutb Shah. Headings and punctuation in red. For scribe's name see f.9a.
msItem.incipit: Ay az tu hadith-i ma'rifat-ra tabyin

listBibl.bibl: None found for the translation. For the Arabic original see Brockelmann.

condition.p: In very poor condition. Unbound and many folios loose. Is accompanied by the back cover originally belonging to a smaller volume.

origin.p: In the first decade of Rabi' II A.H. 1074. This is at the end of the list of contents preceding the text. The scribe is the same throughout.

acquisition.p: Provenance: Unclear, but ssociated wrapping paper suggests the MS was acquired by Ellis from Luzac's

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
